hackathon-description-text: Pollution incidents occur - they are a fact of life.  But what if we could predict these?  The impact could be significant to both the environment, and communities but to individuals affected.
hackathon-eligibility:
Develop your project at the CORE, submit project through Devpost, and participate in the Sunday pitching and judging. In order to be eligible for prizes, you must
Individuals (over 18 years in age); Teams; Organizations (up to 100 employees)
United Kingdom
hackathon-requirements: How does report concept support effectively support practical prediction of pump  station and or system failure due to environmental, operational, and socio-economic factors.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Five applicant will receive funding in support of participation. The NWL team will select participants based on experience and expertise.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Bath Ln, Newcastle upon Tyne NE4, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Smart approaches to integrating available data from local authority, utility and other sources
Beyond operational benefits, the potential to help reduce the frequency of pollution incidents
Consideration given to data expression and predictive model system/ operational integration

hackathon-location-address: Bath Ln, Newcastle upon Tyne NE4, UK
hackathon-description-header: Exploring correlations between pollution incidents and socio-economic / environmental factors
